page.title: 03Rackheath
page.content: Rackheath has grown as a{ribbon {development}along the Norwich to South Walsham road.Housing is mainly small post-war detached bungalows with red pantile roofs.Shopping facilities in the village are rather limited; a small post office/grocery shop,a fish and chip shop and a garage.Fortunately Norwich with its excellent shopping facilities is only a few minutes drive away. The local public house is called the Sole and Heel which may be a link with nearby Norwich's past as a centre for the shoe industry. Although many of the residents of Rackheath commute to Norwich for their work, there is some employment locally on the new{Rackheath Industrial {Estate. }
